classes.title: EDMX704
classes.subtitle: Literacy Reflection.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on reflective literacy teaching: problematizing, processes of understanding students' thinking about reading and writing.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX706
classes.subtitle: Assessment and Accountability.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on reflective literacy teaching: problematizing, processes of understanding students' thinking about reading and writing.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX706
classes.subtitle: Assessment and Accountability.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Provides students with the opportunity to review, renew, and expand their understanding of assessment and program evaluation procedures, as well as the role of accountability in educational settings.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX707
classes.subtitle: Reinventing Teaching.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Provides students with the opportunity to review, renew, and expand their understanding of assessment and program evaluation procedures, as well as the role of accountability in educational settings.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX707
classes.subtitle: Reinventing Teaching.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Admission to the M.Ed. for experienced teachers program required. Addresses contexts of teaching, teaching in the world, and teaching students in schools. This course is designed for experienced educators to "reinvent teachers and teaching.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX708
classes.subtitle: Teacher Researcher I.  1-3 Credits.
classes.description: Admission to the M.Ed. for experienced teachers program required. Addresses contexts of teaching, teaching in the world, and teaching students in schools. This course is designed for experienced educators to "reinvent teachers and teaching.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX708
classes.subtitle: Teacher Researcher I.  1-3 Credits.
classes.description: Enrollment in the M.Ed. for Experienced Teachers program required. Explores the meanings of research and the potential roles of teachers in conducting research. Teachers formulate possible individual or small group research projects that they can carry out during the year.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX709
classes.subtitle: Teacher Researcher II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Enrollment in the M.Ed. for Experienced Teachers program required. Explores the meanings of research and the potential roles of teachers in conducting research. Teachers formulate possible individual or small group research projects that they can carry out during the year.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX709
classes.subtitle: Teacher Researcher II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Teachers will plan and conduct advanced inquiry/research projects informed by their knowledge of teacher-research and their experience as teacher-researchers garnered through their successful completion of EDMX�708.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX710
classes.subtitle: Teacher Leadership for a Democratic Society.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Teachers will plan and conduct advanced inquiry/research projects informed by their knowledge of teacher-research and their experience as teacher-researchers garnered through their successful completion of EDMX�708.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX710
classes.subtitle: Teacher Leadership for a Democratic Society.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on the nature of change and teachers' roles as leaders within a changing environment. Several themes are addressed: shaping school cultures, schools as communities, schools as sites for reform, and politics and schools.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX715
classes.subtitle: Assessment and Differentiation.  1 Credit.
classes.description: Focuses on the nature of change and teachers' roles as leaders within a changing environment. Several themes are addressed: shaping school cultures, schools as communities, schools as sites for reform, and politics and schools.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX715
classes.subtitle: Assessment and Differentiation.  1 Credit.
classes.description: Enrollment in the M.Ed. for experienced teachers program required. Enhances teachers' understanding of how to differentiate assessment.Requisites: Prerequisite, EDMX�707.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX716
classes.subtitle: Assessment and Differentiation.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Enrollment in the M.Ed. for experienced teachers program required. Enhances teachers' understanding of how to differentiate assessment.Requisites: Prerequisite, EDMX�707.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX716
classes.subtitle: Assessment and Differentiation.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Enrollment in the M.Ed. for experienced teachers program required. Enhances teachers' understanding of how to differentiate instruction. Using a case-based approach, teachers examine the areas of human development, special education and inclusion, cultural diversity, linguistic diversity, cognitive styles, and multiple intelligences as frames through which to consider creative environments to promote students' classroom success.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX721
classes.subtitle: Content-Area Reading and Writing.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Enrollment in the M.Ed. for experienced teachers program required. Enhances teachers' understanding of how to differentiate instruction. Using a case-based approach, teachers examine the areas of human development, special education and inclusion, cultural diversity, linguistic diversity, cognitive styles, and multiple intelligences as frames through which to consider creative environments to promote students' classroom success.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX721
classes.subtitle: Content-Area Reading and Writing.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on current theory, research, and issues in the teaching and use of reading and writing in the content areas. This is an introductory course.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX722
classes.subtitle: Advanced Reflective Literacy Teaching.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on current theory, research, and issues in the teaching and use of reading and writing in the content areas. This is an introductory course.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX722
classes.subtitle: Advanced Reflective Literacy Teaching.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Teachers will learn how to problematize assessment of students' thinking about reading and writing in this practicum course.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX723
classes.subtitle: Number Systems and Operations: K-5 Mathematical Tasks.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Teachers will learn how to problematize assessment of students' thinking about reading and writing in this practicum course.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX723
classes.subtitle: Number Systems and Operations: K-5 Mathematical Tasks.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Course has major restrictions. Analysis and construction of effective mathematical tasks in teaching number systems and operations at the K-5 level; attention is also given to the expansion of content knowledge.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX724
classes.subtitle: Data Analysis and Measurement: K-5 Classroom Interactions.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Course has major restrictions. Analysis and construction of effective mathematical tasks in teaching number systems and operations at the K-5 level; attention is also given to the expansion of content knowledge.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX724
classes.subtitle: Data Analysis and Measurement: K-5 Classroom Interactions.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Course has major restrictions. Focuses on statistical literacy of elementary teachers and the teaching of data analysis and measurement to K-5 students; attention is also given to learning methods that facilitate appropriate classroom interactions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX725
classes.subtitle: Rational Numbers and Operations: K-5 Learning Trajectories.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Course has major restrictions. Focuses on statistical literacy of elementary teachers and the teaching of data analysis and measurement to K-5 students; attention is also given to learning methods that facilitate appropriate classroom interactions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX725
classes.subtitle: Rational Numbers and Operations: K-5 Learning Trajectories.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Course has major restrictions. Focuses on rational number concepts through learning trajectories at the K-5 level. Attention also given to problem solving and content knowledge.Requisites: Prerequisite, EDMX�723.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX726
classes.subtitle: Revisiting Real Numbers Concepts.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Course has major restrictions. Focuses on rational number concepts through learning trajectories at the K-5 level. Attention also given to problem solving and content knowledge.Requisites: Prerequisite, EDMX�723.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX726
classes.subtitle: Revisiting Real Numbers Concepts.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Uses a problem-based format and group work to explore the mathematics of the real numbers with an emphasis on rational numbers.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX727
classes.subtitle: Algebraic Reasoning: K-5 Discourse and Questioning.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Uses a problem-based format and group work to explore the mathematics of the real numbers with an emphasis on rational numbers.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX727
classes.subtitle: Algebraic Reasoning: K-5 Discourse and Questioning.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Course has major restrictions. Focus on the early algebra concepts of functional thinking and generalized arithmetic in relationship to pedagogical practices centered on questioning in the mathematics classroom.Requisites: Prerequisite, EDMX�723.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX728
classes.subtitle: Topics in Mathematics Education: Geometry.  1-3 Credits.
classes.description: Course has major restrictions. Focus on the early algebra concepts of functional thinking and generalized arithmetic in relationship to pedagogical practices centered on questioning in the mathematics classroom.Requisites: Prerequisite, EDMX�723.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX728
classes.subtitle: Topics in Mathematics Education: Geometry.  1-3 Credits.
classes.description: Provides students with a mathematical foundation and cognitive support for elementary and middle school geometry. Specific goals address structure of elementary and middle school geometry.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX730
classes.subtitle: Geometry and Spatial Visualization: K-5 Assessment.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Provides students with a mathematical foundation and cognitive support for elementary and middle school geometry. Specific goals address structure of elementary and middle school geometry.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX730
classes.subtitle: Geometry and Spatial Visualization: K-5 Assessment.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Course has major restrictions. Geometric concept development along with formative and summative assessment strategies of students' geometric thinking. Attention also is given to geometric content knowledge and diagnosis of student errors.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX731
classes.subtitle: Writing in the 21st Century.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Course has major restrictions. Geometric concept development along with formative and summative assessment strategies of students' geometric thinking. Attention also is given to geometric content knowledge and diagnosis of student errors.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX731
classes.subtitle: Writing in the 21st Century.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on the writing process and the theoretical foundations necessary to become practitioners who can develop and implement effective writing instruction using 21st-century skills.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX732
classes.subtitle: Explorations in Literacy.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on the writing process and the theoretical foundations necessary to become practitioners who can develop and implement effective writing instruction using 21st-century skills.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX732
classes.subtitle: Explorations in Literacy.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Explores what it means to be a reader and writer, the nature of development of literacy.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX733
classes.subtitle: Spanish for Educators.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Explores what it means to be a reader and writer, the nature of development of literacy.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX733
classes.subtitle: Spanish for Educators.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This graduate-level course is an introductory immersion-style Spanish course for anyone involved in education. Learners will acquire novice-level proficiency in Spanish and an awareness of Hispanic culture.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX734
classes.subtitle: Revisiting Literacy.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This graduate-level course is an introductory immersion-style Spanish course for anyone involved in education. Learners will acquire novice-level proficiency in Spanish and an awareness of Hispanic culture.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX734
classes.subtitle: Revisiting Literacy.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Explores literacy topics as capstone course for master's or licensure program in literacy.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX735
classes.subtitle: Math and Content Area Methods: Special Education, General Curriculum.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Explores literacy topics as capstone course for master's or licensure program in literacy.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX735
classes.subtitle: Math and Content Area Methods: Special Education, General Curriculum.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Students will learn characteristics of students with mild to moderate learning disabilities in math, social studies, and science. They will also learn assessment techniques and instructional methods to address these specific characteristics.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX736
classes.subtitle: Mathematical Modeling: K-5 Leadership.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Students will learn characteristics of students with mild to moderate learning disabilities in math, social studies, and science. They will also learn assessment techniques and instructional methods to address these specific characteristics.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX736
classes.subtitle: Mathematical Modeling: K-5 Leadership.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Restricted to majors. Generating mathematical representations and making explicit connections between concepts. Pedagogy designed to equip elementary teachers to become mathematics teacher-leaders in school settings. Focuses on topics integrated within mathematical strands.Requisites: Prerequisites, EDMX�723, 724, 725, 727, and 730.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX757
classes.subtitle: Social Studies Pedagogy A.  1-9 Credits.
classes.description: Restricted to majors. Generating mathematical representations and making explicit connections between concepts. Pedagogy designed to equip elementary teachers to become mathematics teacher-leaders in school settings. Focuses on topics integrated within mathematical strands.Requisites: Prerequisites, EDMX�723, 724, 725, 727, and 730.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX757
classes.subtitle: Social Studies Pedagogy A.  1-9 Credits.
classes.description: Designed to extend students' professional content knowledge by exploring the content and methods of a social science discipline.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX758
classes.subtitle: Social Studies Pedagogy B.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Designed to extend students' professional content knowledge by exploring the content and methods of a social science discipline.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX758
classes.subtitle: Social Studies Pedagogy B.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Designed to extend students' professional content knowledge by exploring the content and methods of a social science discipline.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX759
classes.subtitle: Contemporary Research for Social Studies Teaching.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Designed to extend students' professional content knowledge by exploring the content and methods of a social science discipline.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX759
classes.subtitle: Contemporary Research for Social Studies Teaching.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on current research topics and methodologies in the field of social studies education and examines their implications on the field.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX760
classes.subtitle: Integrated Learning.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on current research topics and methodologies in the field of social studies education and examines their implications on the field.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX760
classes.subtitle: Integrated Learning.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Builds on earlier coursework and will include teachers from each of the two concentrations in the M.Ed. for Experienced Teachers. It focuses on exploring what is meant by integrated curriculum and understanding the process of developmental research as it relates to the design and use of curricula.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX761
classes.subtitle: Social Studies/Humanities.  1-9 Credits.
classes.description: Builds on earlier coursework and will include teachers from each of the two concentrations in the M.Ed. for Experienced Teachers. It focuses on exploring what is meant by integrated curriculum and understanding the process of developmental research as it relates to the design and use of curricula.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX761
classes.subtitle: Social Studies/Humanities.  1-9 Credits.
classes.description: Aims to develop social studies teachers' understanding of social science and humanities through an interdisciplinary inquiry process.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX762
classes.subtitle: Advanced Emergent and Early Literacy.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Aims to develop social studies teachers' understanding of social science and humanities through an interdisciplinary inquiry process.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX762
classes.subtitle: Advanced Emergent and Early Literacy.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Advanced course on emergent and early literacy, focusing on the research and theory in the development of reading and writing processes from birth through first grade, emphasizing the cognitive and socio-cultural perspectives.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX763
classes.subtitle: Diversity Global Education.  1-9 Credits.
classes.description: Advanced course on emergent and early literacy, focusing on the research and theory in the development of reading and writing processes from birth through first grade, emphasizing the cognitive and socio-cultural perspectives.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX763
classes.subtitle: Diversity Global Education.  1-9 Credits.
classes.description: Provides a linked perspective on international studies and multicultural education. Students explore issues relevant to these two topics as they relate to teaching and learning in social studies.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX764
classes.subtitle: Families and Teams in Early Childhood Intervention: Interdisciplinary Perspectives.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Provides a linked perspective on international studies and multicultural education. Students explore issues relevant to these two topics as they relate to teaching and learning in social studies.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX764
classes.subtitle: Families and Teams in Early Childhood Intervention: Interdisciplinary Perspectives.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Open to graduate students only. Explores issues and models of family-professional and interprofessional relationships in early childhood settings. Collaborative communication and problem-solving strategies are emphasized in the context of diversity.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX765
classes.subtitle: Early Childhood Assessment Strategies.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Open to graduate students only. Explores issues and models of family-professional and interprofessional relationships in early childhood settings. Collaborative communication and problem-solving strategies are emphasized in the context of diversity.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX765
classes.subtitle: Early Childhood Assessment Strategies.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Open to graduate students only. Provides an overview and application of strategies for developmental screenings, normative evaluations, curriculum, and play-based assessments for young children ages birth through five.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX766
classes.subtitle: Preschool/Kindergarten Curriculum and Learning Environments.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Open to graduate students only. Provides an overview and application of strategies for developmental screenings, normative evaluations, curriculum, and play-based assessments for young children ages birth through five.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX766
classes.subtitle: Preschool/Kindergarten Curriculum and Learning Environments.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Open to graduate students only. Focuses on individually, developmentally, and culturally appropriate learning environment and curriculum strategies for young children with and without disabilities ages three to five.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX767
classes.subtitle: Infant/Toddler Curriculum and Learning Environment.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Open to graduate students only. Focuses on individually, developmentally, and culturally appropriate learning environment and curriculum strategies for young children with and without disabilities ages three to five.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX767
classes.subtitle: Infant/Toddler Curriculum and Learning Environment.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on infant/toddler development and mental health strategies for facilitating development in the home and in child care.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX768
classes.subtitle: Professional Development and Leadership in Early Childhood Intervention.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on infant/toddler development and mental health strategies for facilitating development in the home and in child care.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX768
classes.subtitle: Professional Development and Leadership in Early Childhood Intervention.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on leadership skills in mentoring, supervision, staff development, resource gathering, and applied research related to early childhood settings.Requisites: Prerequisites, EDMX�764, 765, and 766.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX775
classes.subtitle: Seminar in Science Education.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on leadership skills in mentoring, supervision, staff development, resource gathering, and applied research related to early childhood settings.Requisites: Prerequisites, EDMX�764, 765, and 766.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX775
classes.subtitle: Seminar in Science Education.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Teaches students curriculum and instruction strategies in science education. The focus of the course is on teaching and assessing science for conceptual understanding.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX776
classes.subtitle: Perspectives on Science Education: Physical Science.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Teaches students curriculum and instruction strategies in science education. The focus of the course is on teaching and assessing science for conceptual understanding.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX776
classes.subtitle: Perspectives on Science Education: Physical Science.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Examines physical science domains in depth. Students reflect on their own understandings of science phenomena and research their students' understandings.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX777
classes.subtitle: Perspectives on Science Education: Life Science.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Examines physical science domains in depth. Students reflect on their own understandings of science phenomena and research their students' understandings.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX777
classes.subtitle: Perspectives on Science Education: Life Science.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Studies the history of science education, curriculum design, and national reform ideas as well as projects and programs currently used in United States classrooms.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX778
classes.subtitle: Perspectives of Science Education: Earth, Space, and Environmental Science.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Studies the history of science education, curriculum design, and national reform ideas as well as projects and programs currently used in United States classrooms.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX778
classes.subtitle: Perspectives of Science Education: Earth, Space, and Environmental Science.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Explores current reforms in science education through an examination of critical topics in earth-space science.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX779
classes.subtitle: Big Ideas in Science Education.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Explores current reforms in science education through an examination of critical topics in earth-space science.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX779
classes.subtitle: Big Ideas in Science Education.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Through investigations, research, and guest speakers, this course engages students in discussions about teaching science in conjunction with issues of technology and society.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX782
classes.subtitle: Behavioral Support Techniques.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Through investigations, research, and guest speakers, this course engages students in discussions about teaching science in conjunction with issues of technology and society.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX782
classes.subtitle: Behavioral Support Techniques.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Emphasizes effective behavior management and applied behavior analysis techniques for intervening in the environments of exceptional children to increase learning.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX789
classes.subtitle: Designing Problem Tasks for Mathematics.  1-3 Credits.
classes.description: Emphasizes effective behavior management and applied behavior analysis techniques for intervening in the environments of exceptional children to increase learning.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX789
classes.subtitle: Designing Problem Tasks for Mathematics.  1-3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on the analysis and construction of mathematics instructional activities.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX792
classes.subtitle: Problem-Based Learning in Mathematics.  1-3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on the analysis and construction of mathematics instructional activities.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX792
classes.subtitle: Problem-Based Learning in Mathematics.  1-3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on the analysis and construction of mathematics instructional activities: tasks, problems, and materials with which students and teachers engage.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX794
classes.subtitle: Developing Mathematical Knowledge.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on the analysis and construction of mathematics instructional activities: tasks, problems, and materials with which students and teachers engage.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX794
classes.subtitle: Developing Mathematical Knowledge.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Designed to help teachers think through the major mathematical ideas of the curriculum and to examine how students develop these ideas.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX810
classes.subtitle: Culturally Responsive Teaching.  2 Credits.
classes.description: Designed to help teachers think through the major mathematical ideas of the curriculum and to examine how students develop these ideas.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: EDMX810
classes.subtitle: Culturally Responsive Teaching.  2 Credits.
classes.description: This course initiates thoughtful discussion of race and culture in our schools by exploring history, identity, and issues in academic achievement.Grading status: Letter grade.
